title: How to Make Cantaloupe Soup

steps.headline: Chop the cantaloupe.
steps.description: Using a knife, remove the skin from the cantaloupe and dice the cantaloupe into cubes. Remove any seeds that the cantaloupe may have.

steps.headline: Blend the cantaloupe and cider.
steps.description: Place the chopped cantaloupe in a blender and pour in the sparkling cider. Blend on high speed for about two minutes until the two are properly combined.

steps.headline: Add the water, lemon juice, pepper, and salt.
steps.description: Pour in the water and lemon juice to the blended cantaloupe. Sprinkle a desired amount of pepper and salt, usually about a pinch.

steps.headline: Blend in the sugar, cucumber, cold water.
steps.description: Add in the sugar, chopped cucumber, and water to the cantaloupe mixture. Blend on medium speed for about three minutes, until the cantaloupe soup is slightly watery and resembles a light orange color.

steps.headline: Pour the soup into a large bowl.
steps.description: Using a rubber spatula, scrape out the cantaloupe soup and place it in a large bowl. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or aluminum foil.

steps.headline: Let the soup chill.
steps.description: Place the bowl in the fridge to chill for about two to three hours. This helps the soup become cold and helps it firm slightly.

steps.headline: Serve and enjoy!
steps.description: Scoop the cantaloupe soup in a serving bowl. Garnish with mint leaves, if desired. Enjoy!

steps.description: Pour the mango juice or chopped mango into the blended cantaloupe. Combine in the ginger and honey. Blend again on high speed for about a minute, until the soup is slightly creamy and resembles a bright orange color.

steps.headline: Blend the cantaloupe and strawberries.
steps.description: Place the chopped cantaloupe in a blender and add in the chopped strawberries. Blend on high speed for about two minutes until the ingredients are properly combined and the mixture resembles a dark orange color.

steps.headline: Add the sour cream and ginger.
steps.description: Add in the sour cream and grated ginger to the blended cantaloupe. Blend again on high speed for about a minute, until the soup is slightly creamy and resembles a bright orange color.

text: Simple Cantaloupe Soup Chop the cantaloupe. Using a knife, remove the skin from the cantaloupe and dice the cantaloupe into cubes. Remove any seeds that the cantaloupe may have. Blend the cantaloupe and cider. Place the chopped cantaloupe in a blender and pour in the sparkling cider. Blend on high speed for about two minutes until the two are properly combined. Add the water, lemon juice, pepper, and salt. Pour in the water and lemon juice to the blended cantaloupe. Sprinkle a desired amount of pepper and salt, usually about a pinch. Blend in the sugar, cucumber, cold water. Add in the sugar, chopped cucumber, and water to the cantaloupe mixture. Blend on medium speed for about three minutes, until the cantaloupe soup is slightly watery and resembles a light orange color. Pour the soup into a large bowl. Using a rubber spatula, scrape out the cantaloupe soup and place it in a large bowl. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or aluminum foil. Let the soup chill. Place the bowl in the fridge to chill for about two to three hours. This helps the soup become cold and helps it firm slightly. Serve and enjoy! Scoop the cantaloupe soup in a serving bowl. Garnish with mint leaves, if desired. Enjoy! Orange Juice Cantaloupe Soup Chop the cantaloupe. Using a knife, remove the skin from the cantaloupe and dice the cantaloupe into cubes. Remove any seeds that the cantaloupe may have. Blend the cantaloupe and orange juice. Place the chopped cantaloupe in a blender and pour in the orange juice. Blend on high speed for about two minutes until the two are properly combined. Add the lime juice and cinnamon. Pour the lime juice and cinnamon into the mixture. Blend on high speed for about three minutes until the soup is slightly watery and resembles a light orange color. Pour the soup into a large bowl. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cantaloupe soup out of the blender and place it in a large bowl. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or aluminum foil. Let the soup chill. Place the bowl in the fridge to chill for about two to three hours. This helps the soup become cold and helps it firm slightly. Serve and enjoy! Scoop the cantaloupe soup in a serving bowl. Garnish with mint leaves, if desired. Enjoy! Vinegar Cantaloupe Soup Chop the cantaloupe. Using a knife, remove the skin from the cantaloupe and dice the cantaloupe into cubes. Remove any seeds that the cantaloupe may have. Blend the cantaloupe and vinegar. Place the chopped cantaloupe in a blender and pour in the orange juice. Blend on high speed for about two minutes until the two are properly combined. Add the lime juice and salt. Pour in the lime juice and add a desired amount of salt to the mixture. Blend on high speed for about three minutes until the soup is slightly watery and resembles a light orange color. Pour the soup into a large bowl. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cantaloupe soup out and place it in a large bowl. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or aluminum foil. Let the soup chill. Place the bowl in the fridge to chill for about two to three hours. This helps the soup become cold and helps it firm slightly. Serve and enjoy! Scoop the cantaloupe soup in a serving bowl. Garnish with mint leaves, if desired. Enjoy! Mango Cantaloupe Soup Chop the cantaloupe. Using a knife, remove the skin from the cantaloupe and dice the cantaloupe into cubes. Remove any seeds that the cantaloupe may have. Blend the cantaloupe and yogurt. Place the chopped cantaloupe in a blender and add in the vanilla yogurt. Blend on high speed for about two minutes until the two are properly combined. Add the mango, ginger, and honey. Pour the mango juice or chopped mango into the blended cantaloupe. Combine in the ginger and honey. Blend again on high speed for about a minute, until the soup is slightly creamy and resembles a bright orange color. Pour the soup into a large bowl. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cantaloupe soup out and place it in a large bowl. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or aluminum foil. Let the soup chill. Place the bowl in the fridge to chill for about two to three hours. This helps the soup become cold and helps it firm slightly. Serve and enjoy! Scoop the cantaloupe soup in a serving bowl. Garnish with mint leaves, if desired. Enjoy! Strawberry Cantaloupe Soup Chop the cantaloupe. Using a knife, remove the skin from the cantaloupe and dice the cantaloupe into cubes. Remove any seeds that the cantaloupe may have. Blend the cantaloupe and strawberries. Place the chopped cantaloupe in a blender and add in the chopped strawberries. Blend on high speed for about two minutes until the ingredients are properly combined and the mixture resembles a dark orange color. Add the sour cream and ginger. Add in the sour cream and grated ginger to the blended cantaloupe. Blend again on high speed for about a minute, until the soup is slightly creamy and resembles a bright orange color. Pour the soup into a large bowl. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cantaloupe soup out and place it in a large bowl. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or aluminum foil. Let the soup chill. Place the bowl in the fridge to chill for about two to three hours. This helps the soup become cold and helps it firm slightly. Serve and enjoy! Scoop the cantaloupe soup in a serving bowl. Garnish with mint leaves and sliced strawberries. Enjoy! Finished.
